raw_text:
O'Driscoll out of Scotland game
 
 Ireland captain Brian O'Driscoll has been ruled out of Saturday's RBS Six Nations clash against Scotland.
 
 O'Driscoll was originally named in the starting line-up but has failed to recover from the hamstring injury he picked up in the win over Italy. His replacement will be named after training on Friday morning. Fellow centre Gordon D'Arcy is also struggling with a hamstring injury and he will undergo a fitness test on Friday to see if he can play.
 
 Kevin Maggs would be an obvious replacement at centre while Shane Horgan could also be moved from wing. Ulster wing Tommy Bowe could also be asked to travel with the squad to Scotland as a precautionary measure. The only other change to the Ireland side sees Wasps flanker Johnny O'Connor replacing Denis Leamy. O'Connor will be winning his third cap after making his debut in the victory over South Africa last November.
 
 : Murphy, Horgan, TBC, D'Arcy, Hickie, O'Gara, Stringer, Corrigan, Byrne, Hayes, O'Kelly, O'Connell, S Easterby, O'Connor, Foley.
 
 : Sheahan, Horan, O'Callaghan, Miller, G Easterby, Humphreys, Dempsey.
llama3.2:1b: Brian O'Driscoll was ruled out of the RBS Six Nations game against Scotland due to a hamstring injury and will be replaced by Kevin Maggs at centre. Gordon D'Arcy is also struggling with a hamstring injury and will undergo a fitness test on Friday.
llama3.2:3b: Ireland captain Brian O'Driscoll has been ruled out of the Scotland game due to a hamstring injury. Gordon D'Arcy is also struggling with an injury and may not play on Friday's fitness test. Kevin Maggs could replace D'Arcoll at centre while Shane Horgan might move from wing, and Tommy Bowe might travel to Scotland as a precaution. Johnny O'Connor will replace Denis Leamy in the flanker position.

He will be replaced by Gordon D'Arcy and Kevin Maggs would also be considered for center while Tommy Bowe may replace Wasps flanker Johnny O'Connor. Ireland faces Scotland in the RBS Six Nations game, which is being played on Saturday.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Ireland's Brian O'Driscoll ruled out of RBS Six Nations match against Scotland due to hamstring injury; Kevin Maggs and Gordon D'Arcy are also injured; replacements still undecided; Ireland changes its flanker from Denis Leamy to Johnny O'Connor for his third cap appearance.
qwen2.5:3b: Ireland captain Brian O'Driscoll has been ruled out due to a hamstring injury sustained against Italy. Fellow centre Gordon D'Arcy is also injured and will undergo a fitness test on Friday. Kevin Maggs and Shane Horgan are considered for the center position while Tommy Bowe could be included as precautionary measure. Wasps flanker Johnny O'Connor makes his third cap after being named in place of Denis Leamy. The only other change involves Wasps player Johnny O'Connor replacing Denis Leamy.

First, the main event is O'Driscoll, the Ireland captain, who has been ruled out of their game against Scotland on Saturday. He was in the starting lineup but had an injury from last time when they won over Italy. His replacement will be on Friday morning. There are other key players mentioned too: D'Arcy, Maggs, Horgan, Bowe, O'Connor, etc., and some fitness tests are scheduled.

I should capture the main points without getting bogged down in details. The summary needs to include who is out, their replacements, and any important changes or moves. Also, I have to make sure I don't include any extra information beyond what's necessary for a concise summary.

So, breaking it down:

- O'Driscoll is out with D'Arcy.
- Replacement for O'driscoll will be on Friday.
- Key other replacements are Maggs and Horgan moving from wing to centre.
- Ulster's Tommy Bowe is being moved back to Scotland as a precaution.
- Johnny O'Connor replaces Denis Leamy, who was in the game last November.

I should list these names concisely. Maybe number them with "Replacement" at the end. Also, make sure I include the fitness tests for D'Arcy and others since that's important.

Putting it all together, I need to keep only the summary without any extra words or explanations. So, each main player and their roles, their names, replacement names, and any necessary details about them.
</think>

O'Driscoll is out of the game with D'Arcy on Friday morning. Maggs and Horgan replace him in centre positions. Tommy Bowe moves to Scotland as a precaution. Johnny O'Connor replaces Denis Leamy, who played last November. Key players include replacement names and fitness tests scheduled for their respective players.
tinyllama:1.1b: In the RBS Six Nations clash against Scotland on Saturday, captain Brian O'Driscoll is ruled out due to an injury sustained in Italy's win. The team has named Ulster wing Tommy Bowe as a possible replacement at centre while Shane Horgan could also be called up for international duty. Kevin Maggs and Wasps flanker Johnny O'Connor are other potential replacements, with O'Connor replacing Denis Leamy in the starting lineup. The only change to the Ireland side is the addition of Wasps defender Johnny O'Connor as a back-up option for wing Tommy Bowe. Other possible changes include Ulster flanker Mark McCann replacing Malcolm Peacock at fullback, and the potential return of Wasps loosehead prop John Horne to the starting XV.
